intro: Cephaelis tatei, commonly known as the yellow flame orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens and private collections.
